actions.actionDescription: Identify and remediate OAuth applications that have been granted excessive permissions or show risky behavior patterns in your environment. This involves reviewing OAuth consent grants in Azure AD and Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps to detect potentially malicious or overprivileged applications.

actions.actionTitle: Generate and view operational report providing app install status
actions.actionDescription: Generate reports from Microsoft Intune to track application installation status across managed devices. These reports provide visibility into deployment success rates, installation failures, and device compliance with application requirements.

actions.actionTitle: Generate and review reports for device compliance
actions.actionDescription: Create and regularly review device compliance reports in Microsoft Intune to ensure devices meet organizational security requirements. These reports help identify non-compliant devices and track remediation efforts across your device fleet.

actions.actionTitle: Configure retention period for deleted users in a shared drive
actions.actionDescription: Set retention policies for data belonging to deleted users in shared drives and OneDrive for Business. This ensures that important data is preserved for compliance and business continuity even after user accounts are removed from the organization.

actions.actionTitle: Generate and review reports for device compliance trends
actions.actionDescription: Analyze historical device compliance data through Microsoft Intune to identify trends and patterns in compliance violations. These trend reports help predict potential security issues and optimize compliance policies based on historical data.

Implement access reviews and monitoring for Azure AD groups to ensure appropriate membership and permissions. This includes regular review of group owners, members, and access rights to maintain the principle of least privilege.

Configure automatic session timeout policies for idle users in Azure AD and Microsoft 365 applications. This security measure helps prevent unauthorized access when users leave their workstations unattended by automatically signing them out after a period of inactivity.

Perform manual updates on remote devices through Microsoft Intune when automatic updates are not suitable or immediate patching is required. This allows administrators to push critical security updates to specific devices or groups on demand.

Enable Microsoft Remote Help to provide secure remote assistance to users while maintaining compliance and audit trails. This feature allows IT administrators to remotely view and control devices with proper authentication and user consent.

actions.actionTitle: Configure indicators for IPs and URLs/domains
actions.actionDescription: Create custom indicators of compromise (IoCs) in Microsoft Defender for Endpoint by specifying malicious IPs, URLs, and domains. These indicators help detect and block known threats across your environment automatically.

actions.actionTitle: Detect new OAuth applications connected to your corporate environment
actions.actionDescription: Monitor and detect newly connected OAuth applications accessing corporate data through Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps. This continuous monitoring helps identify shadow IT and potentially risky third-party applications gaining access to organizational resources.

Configure and manage user provisioning for on-premises applications through Azure AD Application Proxy and provisioning agents. This enables automated user lifecycle management for legacy applications that don't support modern authentication protocols.

Configure browser session policies to prevent persistent browser sessions in Azure AD, requiring users to re-authenticate after closing their browser. This reduces the risk of unauthorized access from shared or public computers.

Customize and control how end users interact with enterprise applications through the My Apps portal and application launcher. This includes configuring application visibility, access permissions, and self-service capabilities for better user experience and security.

actions.actionTitle: Collect and analyze information about cyber threats
actions.actionDescription: Enable threat intelligence collection and analysis through Microsoft 365 Defender and Azure Sentinel to proactively identify emerging threats. This includes aggregating threat data from multiple sources and correlating it with your environment's security telemetry.

Conduct phishing simulation campaigns using Microsoft Defender for Office 365's Attack Simulation Training. These simulations help assess user awareness and identify vulnerable users who need additional security training.

actions.actionTitle: Require mobile devices to lock upon inactivity
actions.actionDescription: Configure device compliance policies in Microsoft Intune to enforce automatic screen locks after a period of inactivity on mobile devices. This prevents unauthorized access to corporate data on unattended mobile devices.

actions.actionTitle: Detect misuse of privileged role access
actions.actionDescription: Monitor and detect anomalous activities by privileged accounts using Azure AD Privileged Identity Management (PIM) and Identity Protection. This includes tracking elevation requests, unusual sign-in patterns, and unauthorized privilege escalations.

Enable automated investigation and response (AIR) capabilities in Microsoft 365 Defender to automatically investigate alerts and remediate threats. This reduces the time to detect and respond to security incidents while maintaining audit trails of all automated actions.

Define and manage groups of removable storage devices in Microsoft Defender for Endpoint to control USB and external storage access. This allows granular control over which removable devices can be used in your environment based on device properties or manufacturer.
